question: Are interest rates described as restrictive, accommodative, or neither?

above_target.assessment: Leaning hawkish (policy is described as restrictive, and inflation is above target, so there may be additional tightening to come).

on_target.assessment: Leaning dovish (rates are described as restrictive, but inflation is at target, so there may be easing in the near future).

below_target.assessment: Dovish (rates are described as restrictive, but inflation is below target, so there will likely be easing in the near future).

above_target.assessment: Hawkish (rates are described as accommodative, but inflation is above target, so there is likely to be tightening).

on_target.assessment: Leaning hawkish (rates are described as accommodative, but inflation is at target, so there may be some tightening in the near future).

below_target.assessment: Leaning dovish (policy is described as accommodative, and inflation is below target, so there may be additional loosening to come).

Neither.assessment: Neutral (No strong bias towards tightening or easing)
